SENSES.SENSE: an official instruction to do something<font color=blue> ex: The department has given us a charge to work within certain parameters. </font>
the amount or type of electrical force that something has. The protons in an atom have a positive charge, and the electrons have a negative charge.
an attack by people or animals running very fast toward someone or something<font color=blue> ex: Captain Walker led a charge straight into an enemy stronghold. </font>
an amount of the substance that makes a bomb explode
someone that you are responsible for and take care of<font color=blue> ex: She didn't like it when her young charges started crying. </font>
the ability to produce strong emotions or feelings<font color=blue> ex: a real-life tragedy that gave the movie a serious emotional charge </font>
an official statement accusing someone of committing a crime<font color=blue> ex: The leadership rejected charges that it was insensitive to the plight of the unemployed. </font>

an amount of money that you have to pay, especially when you visit a place or when someone does something for you<font color=blue> ex: There is a charge of $50 if you are over a week late with your payment. </font>
